document.docTitle: Homidia obliquistria Ma & Pan, 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Homidia (Collembola: Entomobryidae) from Southwestern China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Homidia (Collembola: Entomobryidae) from Southwestern China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types .
Holotype : ♀ on slide, Qianlingshan Park , Guiyang City , Guizhou Province , CHINA , Qian-sheng Sun leg. (#1128)
.
Paratypes : Three ♀ on slides, same data as holotype. All deposited in NTU.
Description. Body length up to 3.1 mm .

Complete sens and ms on Th. IĪAbd. III as 22|122(about 25)3 and 10|1 0 100. Th. II with 4 medio-medial (m1, m2, m 2i , m 2i 2), 3 medio-sublateral (m4, m 4i , m4p), about 40 posterior mac and p6 as mac. Th. III with 49̄56 mac and p4̄6 as mac ( Fig. 36 ). Pseudopores on coxa ĪIII as 2, 3, 2 respectively, coxal macrochaetal formula as 3/4+1, 3/4+2 ( Fig. 37 ). Trochanteral organ with 53̄64 smooth spiny chaetae ( Fig. 38 ). Partial inner differentiated tibiotarsal chaetae with ciliations closely appressed to axis; most distal smooth chaeta present on hind leg. Tenent hair capitate and subequal to inner edge of unguis in length. Unguis with 3 inner and 2 lateral teeth. Unguiculus lanceolate with outer edge slightly serrate and basal tooth larger ( Fig. 39 ).

Homidia obliquistria
sp. nov.
29, basal Ant. I; 30, apex of Ant. IV; 31, cephalic chaetotaxy; 32, prelabral and labral chaetae; 33, maxillary outer lobe; 34, labial papilla E; 35, labial and posterior labial chaetae; 36, chaetotaxy of Th. II̅III; 37, coxal macrochaetal formula: A, fore leg; B, mid leg; C, hind leg; 38, trochanteral organ; 39, distal tibiotarsus and claw complex of hind leg.

Homidia obliquistria
sp. nov.
40, chaetotaxy of Abd. I̅III; 41̅42, chaetotaxy of Abd IV; 43, anterior face of ventral tube; 44, posterior face of ventral tube; 45, lateral flap of ventral tube; 46, tenaculum; 47, manubrial plaque; 48, mucro.

subSubSection.paragraph: Ecology. Found in decomposing leaf litter.
Etymology. Specific epithet name is refers to the oblique stripes present on lateral sides of Abd. ĪIII (Latin obliqui + strita ).

Remarks. The new species is characterised by colour pattern, M2 present on labium, slightly expanded chaetae on posterior labium and numerous mac and mes on Abd. IV. It is the most similar to
H. polyseta
in colour pattern, mac and mes on central Abd. IV and dorsal chaetotaxy of Th. IĪAbd. III. However, it can be discriminated from the latter by labial basal chaetae, medio-medial mac on Th. II, mac on Abd. I and narrow black bands on lateral side of Abd. ĪIII. This new species is also similar to
H. latifolia
in colour pattern and expanded chaetae on labium, but it can be distinguished from the latter by many mac and mes on central Abd. IV and narrow black bands on lateral side of Abd. ĪIII. The detailed differences between them are listed in Table 3 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 3. Comparison of
H. obliquistria
sp. nov. ,
H. latifolia
.
and
H. polyseta
.

tr.th: Oblique stripes laterally on Abd. I̅III
Paired black patches on medio-posterior Abd. III
Narrow black bands on posterior margin of Abd. II̅III
Chaetae on anterior row of Abd. IV
Chaetae on posterior part of Abd. IV

subSubSection.paragraph: The present study was supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (31601880) and Zhejiang Provincial Natural Science Foundation of China (LQ14C040002). Thanks are given to Dr. F. Zhang (Nanjing Agricultural University) and anonymous referees who provided advice on this manuscript and greatly improved it.
